attributes.action: Make parking in parent and child spaces without a child a ticketable offence
attributes.additional_details:
The spaces aren't needed due to their proximity to the the shop, they provide much needed space for parents to get their children out of the car and into a pram. 

Supermarket have no power over this as the restrictions on disabled parking doesn't apply to Parent and child spaces and this causes the abuse of such spaces. I have been verbally abused when challenging people (in one instance a man told me to F off. He had a dog in his car and claimed that we as good as having a child).
attributes.background: As most parents of a small child it infuriates me when you're looking for a parent and child parking space and discover that they're are taken up by people with no children.

rejection.details: This would be the responsibility of car park operators and local councils, not the UK Government or Parliament.
